		Question: what did thomas edison do for the world
		Answer:
answer:
Sure, here's the answer to the question:
Thomas Edison, born in 1845, was an American inventor and businessman who revolutionized many fields. One of the most notable contributions of Edison was his invention of the incandescent light bulb in 1879. He also invented the phonograph, the motion-picture camera, and the telegraph. These inventions greatly influenced the world and paved the way for many technological advancements of the modern era.

Some additional contribution from Edison
